info.name: GoCardless
info.description: # üëã Introduction Documentation for how to use this collection, including a Quickstart guide, is available on the [GoCardless Developer Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/getting-started/introduction). Detailed documentation for GoCardless API endpoints is at the [GoCardless API reference guide](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/). ## üìù Prerequisites [Postman](https://www.getpostman.com/downloads/) [GoCardless Account](https://manage-sandbox.gocardless.com/) Before you begin, set up your free GoCardless Sandbox account. Here, you can create an access token to add to your forked Postman collection. ## üèÉ Getting Started 1\. Create a GoCardless Sandbox account [here](https://manage-sandbox.gocardless.com/sign-up): the sandbox is our dedicated testing environment where you can build and test your integration without touching real money. 2\. Go to [Developers > Create > Access Token](https://manage-sandbox.gocardless.com/developers/access-tokens/create) to generate an API access token. Give it a memorable name, with read-write access. 3\. [Fork](https://www.postman.com/gocardlessapi/workspace/gocardless-api/collection/22460459-bae9db02-4aec-428e-bbe4-c36d6d199fd0/fork?origin=tab) the collection into Postman to synchronize with future updates. 4\. Set up a [Postman Environment](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/managing-environments/) for the GoCardless API collection by navigating to Environments and selecting the + icon to create a new environment. 5\. Navigate to an API call you'd like to test to save your key into the collection: - With an API call open, click into "Authorization" - Expand the section - Paste in Copy the access token from _step 2_. - "Save authorization to collection" with the link # Things to Note 1. There are often additional URL parameters or various request bodies that can be passed, we recommended going through our API Developer Guide [here](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#core-endpoints) and amending the requests as necessary. 2. The Bank Account field requirements will vary depending on the scheme and payment method - please update the relevant requests accordingly. See more info [here](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#appendix-local-bank-details). 3. Our requests are chained together automatically via Environment variables, so there is no need to copy & paste IDs across requests. 4. Enjoy! ü•≥

item.description:
## **Creating a Billing Request (**[docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/billing-requests/overview)**)**

To take an instant first payment and set up a Direct Debit mandate, you must create your Billing Request with both the `payment_request` and `mandate_request` objects.

After submitting the create Billing Request call, you‚Äôll receive a Billing Request object in the response, including properties like actions and resources.

The Billing Request will be status `pending`, you‚Äôll need to complete the outstanding actions before it can be fulfilled to create the payment and mandate.

You can use Billing Request Flows API to generate a hosted page that guides the payer through these actions as outlined below.

## **Creating a Billing Request Flow**

> Select "Read Refund Account Bank" to automatically pull the Bank Account Details for the happy path. Otherwise, enter the following test bank details: 
  
> Sort Code: `20-00-00`  
Account: `55779911` 
  

Billing Request Flows can be created against Billing Requests, and provide an entry into a hosted GoCardless flow that completes whatever actions remain on the Billing Request.

Use the Create a Billing Request Flow API to generate the authorisation_url (i.e. hosted GoCardless flow) to send to your customer. Once the customer completes the hosted flow, the first instant payment and the Direct Debit mandate will be created, and the Billing Request will be fulfilled.

Because this is an instant first payment, the funds would be confirmed within minutes of the request going through and leave the customer‚Äôs bank account immediately.

You can also create future payments against the Direct Debit mandate as outlined in Step 2.

request.description:
Creates a new payment object.

This fails with a mandate_is_inactive error if the linked mandate is cancelled or has failed. Payments can be created against mandates with status of: pending_customer_approval, pending_submission, submitted, and active.

[Create a Payment API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#payments-create-a-payment)

response.name: Create a Direct Debit Payment

item.description:
Once you have a mandate for a customer, you can collect payments via the Direct Debit rails using the `/payments` or `/subscriptions` API.

First - retrieve the Billing Request to obtain the newly created Mandate ID. This will automatically added to your environment variables.

## Payments

The [/payments](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#payments-create-a-payment) API allows you to create a single payment against the customer‚Äôs mandate. When creating the payment, you can define the amount and charge date, among other properties.

## Subscriptions

The [/subscriptions](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#subscriptions-create-a-subscription) API allows you to create payments against a mandate according to a provided schedule. When creating a subscription, you can define your recurrence rules, and GoCardless will generate the Direct Debit payments accordingly.

## Instalment Schedules

The [/instalment_schedules](https://developer.gocardless.com/direct-debit/taking-installment-payments) API allows you to configure customised repayment schedules accrosing to amount and/or time.

Under the hood, GoCardless creates and manages the creation of a Payment for the banks according to the rules you have applied to a given form of Payment. Should the payment fall on a non processing day (typically weekends and bank holidays for Direct Debit), GoCardless will automatically adjust the collection timings and reflect this instantly on the payment resources.

item.description:
## **Events**

A webhook is a request that GoCardless sends to your server to alert you of an event. Adding support for webhooks allows you to receive real-time notifications from GoCardless when things happen in your account so that you can take automated actions in response, for example:

- When a payment fails due to lack of funds, retry it automatically
    
- When a customer cancels their mandate with the bank, suspend their account
    
- When a customer‚Äôs subscription generates a new payment, you can record that payment against their account  
    

## Webhooks Configuration

You can learn more about setting up your webhooks [here](https://developer.gocardless.com/getting-started/staying-up-to-date-with-webhooks). Please supply us with your endpoint to send our webhooks to.  

Webhooks are backed by events.¬†

An event refers to an updated resource, such as a payment collected or a mandate transferred.¬†  

See [here](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#event-actions) for a complete list of event types and [here](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#event-actions) for a list of associated event actions.  

The `/events` endpoint surfaces a running log of all GoCardless events, with an extensive set of filters available.

Explore global payment journeys

request.description:
##### Note: Variable Recurring Payments feature is only available to approved integrators with the¬†`VRP Sweeping`¬†upgrade.¬†If you're interested in trying it out - please¬†[contact support](mailto:help@gocardless.com).

> Variable Recurring Payments (VRPs) are a powerful new capability for Open Banking in the UK. 
  

Create a VRP using Billing Requests to prepare a Billing Request Flow to redirect the user towards in order to gain authorisation.

## Constraints

- `start_date` - the date from which the consent will be valid. It will be shown to a payer to confirm and hence should be considered in the payer timezone. This date cannot be older than the date when the payer authorises the consent. Therefore if you want to specify it, make sure that it is not in the past and that the payer has enough time to complete the flow before the date will come.
- `end_date` - the date after which we will not be able to collect payments, as the consent stops being valid. It will be shown to a payer to confirm and hence should be considered in the payer timezone. This date cannot be in the past or older than the start date.
- `max_amount_per_payment` - maximum amount that can be charged for a single payment.
- `periodic_limits` - frequency configuration
    - `period` - repeating time frame presented as "year", "month", "week" or "day".
    - `max_total_amount` - maximum total amount that can be charged for all payments in the period.
    - `max_payments` - maximum amount of payments that can be taken within a period
    - `alignment` - Specifies whether the period starts when the mandate is created or lines up with a calendar date. When the period alignment is calendar based, the first payment is pro-rated to the number of remaining days from the start of the period. By default, this is set to mandate `creation_date`.

See [Billing Requests: Variable Recurring Payments](https://developer.gocardless.com/billing-requests/variable-recurring-payments) for how-to‚Äôs, explanations and tutorials.

[Create a Billing Request API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests-create-a-billing-request)

request.description:
PayTo is a new, efficient way to initiate real-time payments from customers‚Äô bank accounts in Australia. GoCardless has implemented PayTo within Billing Requests to enable two key payments use cases:

1. Setting up an open mandate with your customer
2. Taking one-off real-time payments
    

_A note on definitions: PayTo uses the term ‚Äúagreement‚Äù to refer to the contract between the GoCardless customer and the end-customer. This concept matches that of the ‚Äúmandate‚Äù so, for consistency, we use this term in the API and documentation instead. Please be aware that the terms are synonymous and that the end-customer will see the term ‚Äúagreement‚Äù in the payment flow._

## Constraints

- `start_date` - the date from which the consent will be valid. It will be shown to a payer to confirm and hence should be considered in the payer timezone. This date cannot be older than the date when the payer authorises the consent. Therefore if you want to specify it, make sure that it is not in the past and that the payer has enough time to complete the flow before the date will come.
- `end_date` - the date after which we will not be able to collect payments, as the consent stops being valid. It will be shown to a payer to confirm and hence should be considered in the payer timezone. This date cannot be in the past or older than the start date.
- `max_amount_per_payment` - maximum amount that can be charged for a single payment.
- `periodic_limits` - frequency configuration
    - `period` - repeating time frame presented as "year", "month", "week" or "day".
    - `max_total_amount` - maximum total amount that can be charged for all payments in the period.
    - `max_payments` - maximum amount of payments that can be taken within a period
    - `alignment` - Specifies whether the period starts when the mandate is created or lines up with a calendar date. When the period alignment is calendar based, the first payment is pro-rated to the number of remaining days from the start of the period. By default, this is set to mandate `creation_date`.

See [Billing Requests: PayTo Agreements and Payments](https://developer.gocardless.com/billing-requests/taking-a-payto-mandate-and-payment) for how-to‚Äôs, explanations and tutorials.

[Create a Billing Request API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests-create-a-billing-request)

response.name: üá¶üá∫ PayTo Mandate

item.description:
**GoCardless currently supports**¬†

- Direct Debit payments in USD, CAD, GBP, EUR, SEK, DKK, AUD and NZD
    
- One-off [Instant Bank Payments](https://gocardless.com/solutions/instant-bank-pay/) via open banking in GBP, EUR, and AUD
    
- Recurring Instant Bank Payments in GBP ([VRP](https://developer.gocardless.com/billing-requests/variable-recurring-payments)) and AUD ([PayTo](https://developer.gocardless.com/billing-requests/taking-a-payto-mandate-and-payment))¬†
    

The API requests in this folder can help you get started testing global payments by creating Billing Requests for additional currencies and schemes.

After creating the Billing Request, you can fulfil it by creating & completing a Billing Request Flow.

request.description:
If the billing request has a pending collect_customer_details action, this endpoint can be used to collect the details in order to complete it. The endpoint takes the same payload as Customers, but checks that the customer fields are populated correctly for the billing request scheme. Whatever is provided to this endpoint is used to update the referenced customer, and will take effect immediately after the request is successful. *Note: the region field should be uncommented for US customer addresses.*
[Collect Customer Details API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests-collect-customer-details-for-the-billing-request)

request.description:
If the billing request has a pending collect_bank_account action, this endpoint can be used to collect the details in order to complete it.

The endpoint takes the same payload as Customer Bank Accounts, but check the bank account is valid for the billing request scheme before creating and attaching it.

*Note: Customer bank accounts can be created with local or international bank details. You can find the different local bank detail formats, and how they should be used with the GoCardless API [here.](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#appendix-local-bank-details)*

[Collect Bank Account Details API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests-collect-bank-account-details-for-the-billing-request)

item.description:
Before you can collect any payments by Direct Debit, your customer¬†must¬†issue you with a mandate.

This mandate is called a "Direct Debit Instruction", or "Direct Debit Mandate".

Please note, that without a mandate, your bank cannot authorise the Direct Debit Instruction which allows your customers to collect future payments automatically.

You can generate this Mandate purely through the API with the following set of calls in this folder, provided that you have collected the key information we require (personal customer details, bank details and customer consent).

item.description:
Open Banking, with regard to Payment collection (PIS), encompasses a variety of Payment mechanisms operating via the OB protocols.

Today, these include:

- Instant Payments (IBP)
- Variable Recurring Payments (VRP)
- PayTo
    

### **Instant Bank Pay** üá¨üáß üá™üá∫

Designed to complement bank debit using [open banking](https://gocardless.com/guides/posts/open-banking/). These bank-to-bank payments are confirmed instantly, which means better visibility for you and your customers. Use cases would align with any one off or up front payments that would otherwise normally be done via card.

The example API calls demonstrate how to generate a bank authorisation link.

With this link, you would forward your payer to deeplink them into their banking app or online banking, awaiting their authorisation to approve this instant push payment.

### Variable Recurring Payments üá¨üáß

Variable Recurring Payments (VRP) are a powerful new capability for Open Banking in the UK.

It is a payment method that allows payers (end customers) to grant a single consent, or mandate in GoCardless language, that facilitates multiple payments; enabling innovation in payment experiences and the creation of new types of financial services.

### **PayTo** üá¶üá∫

A new digital way for merchants and businesses to initiate real-time payments from customer bank accounts mandated by Australia‚Äôs New Payments Platform (NPP).

Implementing your own custom-built online payment pages ensures you can provide a bespoke, uncompromised brand experience that seamlessly integrates with your preferred customer onboarding user journey.

They are hosted directly on your website or online application and operate in conjunction with a wider integration with our API, which sets up your new clients as they complete the signup process.

The calls in this folder outline how you may take advantage of a fully custom user experience by completing each step of the onboarding and authorisation process via API only, allowing you to craft a bespoke user experience.

Across all payment schemes, the following information must be captured and/or displayed:

- Bank account holder‚Äôs name
    
- Bank account details
    
- Email address
    
- Confirmation that payments are powered by GoCardless
    

And the required information must be captured and displayed to the customer across a three stage flow.

1. _Payment setup_¬†: Collect your customer‚Äôs details
    
2. _Confirmation_¬†: Display information back to the customer so they can confirm
    
3. _Success_¬†: Confirm completion of the process
    

Learn more [here](https://hub.gocardless.com/s/article/Custom-payment-pages?language=en_GB).

## **Explore additional payment journeys**

**Direct Debit**

Gocardless operates Direct Debit across 8 global schemes. You select your scheme simple by chaging the currency:

**Open Banking**

Use instant rails for immediate payment confirmation and collection

## Customise the user experience

Our Hosted Pages offer a fast and compliant way to take Direct Debit and/or Open Banking payments. Dive into leveraging our Billing Requests to easily sping up a variety of flows across Open Banking to utilise the most advanced versions of account to account payments.

The folders in this section will guide you through the first steps in making your first GoCardless calls in our Sandbox environment. You will explore: - using Billing Requests to generate a dual payment across PIS (instant payment mechanism) and Direct Debit (recurring payments) - scheduling upcoming payments against the generated Mandate (Direct Debit) - follow the Next Steps to explore additional payment methods GoCardless offers ## Prerequisite Follow the steps listed [here](https://www.postman.com/speeding-satellite-655834/workspace/team-workspace/collection/20372907-b3a1fe8a-9dbd-4f0e-8657-1a8c11dc2d12%5D(https://www.postman.com/speeding-satellite-655834/workspace/team-workspace/collection/20372907-b3a1fe8a-9dbd-4f0e-8657-1a8c11dc2d12) to set up your GoCardless account and obtain set your access token. Add this to Postman via the "Authorization" tab.

request.description:
##### Note: Variable Recurring Payments feature is only available to approved integrators with the¬†`VRP Sweeping`¬†upgrade.¬†If you're interested in trying it out - please¬†[contact support](mailto:help@gocardless.com).

> Variable Recurring Payments (VRPs) are a powerful new capability for Open Banking in the UK. 
  

Create a VRP using Billing Requests to prepare a Billing Request Flow to redirect the user towards in order to gain authorisation.

## Constraints

- `start_date` - the date from which the consent will be valid. It will be shown to a payer to confirm and hence should be considered in the payer timezone. This date cannot be older than the date when the payer authorises the consent. Therefore if you want to specify it, make sure that it is not in the past and that the payer has enough time to complete the flow before the date will come.
- `end_date` - the date after which we will not be able to collect payments, as the consent stops being valid. It will be shown to a payer to confirm and hence should be considered in the payer timezone. This date cannot be in the past or older than the start date.
- `max_amount_per_payment` - maximum amount that can be charged for a single payment.
- `periodic_limits` - frequency configuration
    - `period` - repeating time frame presented as "year", "month", "week" or "day".
    - `max_total_amount` - maximum total amount that can be charged for all payments in the period.
    - `max_payments` - maximum amount of payments that can be taken within a period
    - `alignment` - Specifies whether the period starts when the mandate is created or lines up with a calendar date. When the period alignment is calendar based, the first payment is pro-rated to the number of remaining days from the start of the period. By default, this is set to mandate `creation_date`.

See [Billing Requests: Variable Recurring Payments](https://developer.gocardless.com/billing-requests/variable-recurring-payments) for how-to‚Äôs, explanations and tutorials.

[Create a Billing Request API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests-create-a-billing-request)

## Constraints

- `start_date` - the date from which the consent will be valid. It will be shown to a payer to confirm and hence should be considered in the payer timezone. This date cannot be older than the date when the payer authorises the consent. - `max_amount_per_payment` - maximum amount that can be charged for a single payment.
- `periodic_limits` - frequency configuration

When the period alignment is calendar based, the first payment is pro-rated to the number of remaining days from the start of the period. By default, this is set to mandate `creation_date`.

request.description:
PayTo is a new, efficient way to initiate real-time payments from customers‚Äô bank accounts in Australia. GoCardless has implemented PayTo within Billing Requests to enable two key payments use cases:

1. Setting up an open mandate with your customer
2. Taking one-off real-time payments
    

_A note on definitions: PayTo uses the term ‚Äúagreement‚Äù to refer to the contract between the GoCardless customer and the end-customer. This concept matches that of the ‚Äúmandate‚Äù so, for consistency, we use this term in the API and documentation instead. Please be aware that the terms are synonymous and that the end-customer will see the term ‚Äúagreement‚Äù in the payment flow._

## Constraints

- `start_date` - the date from which the consent will be valid. It will be shown to a payer to confirm and hence should be considered in the payer timezone. This date cannot be older than the date when the payer authorises the consent. Therefore if you want to specify it, make sure that it is not in the past and that the payer has enough time to complete the flow before the date will come.
- `end_date` - the date after which we will not be able to collect payments, as the consent stops being valid. It will be shown to a payer to confirm and hence should be considered in the payer timezone. This date cannot be in the past or older than the start date.
- `max_amount_per_payment` - maximum amount that can be charged for a single payment.
- `periodic_limits` - frequency configuration
    - `period` - repeating time frame presented as "year", "month", "week" or "day".
    - `max_total_amount` - maximum total amount that can be charged for all payments in the period.
    - `max_payments` - maximum amount of payments that can be taken within a period
    - `alignment` - Specifies whether the period starts when the mandate is created or lines up with a calendar date. When the period alignment is calendar based, the first payment is pro-rated to the number of remaining days from the start of the period. By default, this is set to mandate `creation_date`.

See [Billing Requests: PayTo Agreements and Payments](https://developer.gocardless.com/billing-requests/taking-a-payto-mandate-and-payment) for how-to‚Äôs, explanations and tutorials.

[Create a Billing Request API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests-create-a-billing-request)

response.name: PayTo Mandate

request.description:
PayTo is a new, efficient way to initiate real-time payments from customers‚Äô bank accounts in Australia. GoCardless has implemented PayTo within Billing Requests to enable two key payments use cases:

1. Setting up an open mandate with your customer
2. Taking one-off real-time payments
    

_A note on definitions: PayTo uses the term ‚Äúagreement‚Äù to refer to the contract between the GoCardless customer and the end-customer. This concept matches that of the ‚Äúmandate‚Äù so, for consistency, we use this term in the API and documentation instead. Please be aware that the terms are synonymous and that the end-customer will see the term ‚Äúagreement‚Äù in the payment flow._

## Constraints

- `start_date` - the date from which the consent will be valid. It will be shown to a payer to confirm and hence should be considered in the payer timezone. This date cannot be older than the date when the payer authorises the consent. Therefore if you want to specify it, make sure that it is not in the past and that the payer has enough time to complete the flow before the date will come.
- `end_date` - the date after which we will not be able to collect payments, as the consent stops being valid. It will be shown to a payer to confirm and hence should be considered in the payer timezone. This date cannot be in the past or older than the start date.
- `max_amount_per_payment` - maximum amount that can be charged for a single payment.
- `periodic_limits` - frequency configuration
    - `period` - repeating time frame presented as "year", "month", "week" or "day".
    - `max_total_amount` - maximum total amount that can be charged for all payments in the period.
    - `max_payments` - maximum amount of payments that can be taken within a period
    - `alignment` - Specifies whether the period starts when the mandate is created or lines up with a calendar date. When the period alignment is calendar based, the first payment is pro-rated to the number of remaining days from the start of the period. By default, this is set to mandate `creation_date`.

See [Billing Requests: PayTo Agreements and Payments](https://developer.gocardless.com/billing-requests/taking-a-payto-mandate-and-payment) for how-to‚Äôs, explanations and tutorials.

[Create a Billing Request API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests-create-a-billing-request)

response.name: PayTo Mandate and Payment

item.description: Find pre-made Billing Requests that you may use as an entry point to the different forms of payment our Billing Request is able to create.

request.description:
Billing Requests help create resources that require input or action from a customer. An example of required input might be additional customer billing details, while an action would be asking a customer to authorise a payment using their mobile banking app.

See [Billing Requests: Overview](https://developer.gocardless.com/getting-started/billing-requests/overview/) for how-to‚Äôs, explanations and tutorials.

[Create a Billing Request API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests-create-a-billing-request)

response.name: Create a Billing Request

request.description:
If the billing request has a pending collect_customer_details action, this endpoint can be used to collect the details in order to complete it. The endpoint takes the same payload as Customers, but checks that the customer fields are populated correctly for the billing request scheme. Whatever is provided to this endpoint is used to update the referenced customer, and will take effect immediately after the request is successful. *Note: the region field should be uncommented for US customer addresses.*
[Collect Customer Details API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests-collect-customer-details-for-the-billing-request)

response.name: Collect Customer Details

request.description:
If the billing request has a pending collect_bank_account action, this endpoint can be used to collect the details in order to complete it.

The endpoint takes the same payload as Customer Bank Accounts, but check the bank account is valid for the billing request scheme before creating and attaching it.

*Note: Customer bank accounts can be created with local or international bank details. You can find the different local bank detail formats, and how they should be used with the GoCardless API [here.](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#appendix-local-bank-details)*

[Collect Bank Account Details API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests-collect-bank-account-details-for-the-billing-request)

response.name: Collect Bank Account Details

request.description:

*Note: Customer bank accounts can be created with local or international bank details. You can find the different local bank detail formats, and how they should be used with the GoCardless API [here.](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#appendix-local-bank-details)*

response.name: Notify Customer of Billing Request

query.description: Cursor pointing to the start of the desired set.
Cursor pointing to the end of the desired set.
Fixed timestamp, recording when this resource was created.
ID of a customer. If specified, this endpoint will return all requests for the given customer.
Number of records to return.

One of:
pending: the billing request is pending and can be used

ready_to_fulfil: the billing request is ready to fulfil

fulfilling: the billing request is currently undergoing fulfilment

fulfilled: the billing request has been fulfilled and a payment created

cancelled: the billing request has been cancelled and cannot be used

request.description:
Retrieves the details of a single billing request.

[Get a single Billing Request API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests-get-a-single-billing-request)

response.name: Get a Billing Request

item.description:
Billing Requests are designed to handle all GoCardless payment options, giving you access to multiple payment rails through one API. These payment options include, but not limited to:

1. Setting up a DD mandate by passing the `mandate_request` object
    
2. Taking a one off Open Banking payment (Instant Bank Payment) by passing the `payment_request` object
    
3. Combining (1) and (2) to take the first payment and also setup a DD mandate for subsequent payments by passing both the mandate_request & payment_request objects
    
4. Taking a recurring Open Banking payment (Variable Recurring Payments)
    

[Create a Billing Request API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests-create-a-billingrequest)

item.description: The Billing Request Flow loads the Billing Request and attempts to complete all required Billing Request actions. Integrators who want to build custom flows may do so by completing most of the required actions, and using a Billing Request Flow to handle the remaining incomplete actions.

item.name: Bank Authorisations

request.description:
Create a Bank Authorisation.

[Create a Bank Authorisation API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#bank-authorisations-create-a-bank-authorisation)

response.name: Create a Bank Authorisation

request.description:
Fetches a bank authorisation.

[Get a Bank Authorisation API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#bank-authorisations-get-a-bank-authorisation)

response.name: Get Bank Authorisation

item.description:
Bank Authorisations can be used to authorise Billing Requests. Authorisations are created against a specific bank, usually the bank that provides the payer‚Äôs account.

Creation of Bank Authorisations is only permitted from GoCardless hosted UIs (see Billing Request Flows) to ensure we meet regulatory requirements for checkout flows.

item.description:
Billing Requests help create resources that require input or action from a customer. An example of required input might be additional customer billing details, while an action would be asking a customer to authorise a payment using their mobile banking app.

There are three primary use cases for Billing Requests:

1. Setting up a DD mandate
2. Taking an Instant Bank Payment
3. Combining (1) and (2) to take the first payment and also setup a DD mandate for subsequent payments

Integrators should create a Billing Request that specifies their desired outcome, picking one of the above use cases, then use the Billing Request Flow to create a checkout flow that takes their customers through the necessary setup.

The Billing Request Flow loads the Billing Request and attempts to complete all required Billing Request actions. Integrators who want to build custom flows may do so by completing most of the required actions, and using a Billing Request Flow to handle the remaining incomplete actions.

[Billing Requests Overview](https://developer.gocardless.com/getting-started/billing-requests/overview/)

item.description:
Blocks are created to prevent certain customer details from being used when creating mandates.

The details used to create blocks can be exact matches, like a bank account or an email, or a more generic match such as an email domain. New block types may be added over time.

A block object is in essence a simple rule that is used to match against details in a newly created mandate. If there is a successful match then the mandate is transitioned to a ‚Äúblocked‚Äù state.

Payments and subscriptions cannot be created against a mandate in blocked state.

A mandate can never be transitioned out of the blocked state.

[https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#core-endpoints-blocks](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#core-endpoints-blocks)

item.description:
Each payment taken through the API is linked to a ‚Äúcreditor‚Äù, to whom the payment is then paid out. In most cases your organisation will have a single ‚Äúcreditor‚Äù, but the API also supports collecting payments on behalf of others.

Please get in touch if you wish to use this endpoint. Currently, for Anti Money Laundering reasons, any creditors you add must be directly related to your organisation.

item.name: Customer Bank Accounts

request.description:
***Please consider using the [Billing Requests API](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests) instead of Customer Bank Accounts for any future integrations.***

Creates a new customer bank account object.

There are three different ways to supply bank account details:

- Local details
- IBAN
- Customer Bank Account Tokens

*Note: Customer bank accounts can be created with local or international bank details. You can find the different local bank detail formats, and how they should be used with the GoCardless API [here.](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#appendix-local-bank-details)*

[Create a customer bank account API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#customer-bank-accounts-create-a-customer-bank-account)

response.name: Create a Customer Bank Account

request.description:
Updates a customer bank account object. Only the metadata parameter is allowed.

[Update a customer bank account API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#customer-bank-accounts-update-a-customer-bank-account)

response.name: Update a Customer Bank Account

item.name: Get a single Customer Bank Account

request.description:
Retrieves the details of an existing bank account.

[Get a single customer bank account API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#customer-bank-accounts-get-a-single-customer-bank-account)

response.name: Get a single Customer Bank Account

request.description:
Immediately cancels all associated mandates and cancellable payments.

This will return a disable_failed error if the bank account has already been disabled.

A disabled bank account can be re-enabled by creating a new bank account resource with the same details.

[Disable a customer bank account API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#customer-bank-accounts-disable-a-customer-bank-account)

response.name: Disable a Customer Bank Account

item.description:
Customer Bank Accounts hold the bank details of a customer. They always belong to a customer, and may be linked to several Direct Debit mandates.

Note that customer bank accounts must be unique, and so you will encounter a bank_account_exists error if you try to create a duplicate bank account. You may wish to handle this by updating the existing record instead, the ID of which will be provided as links[customer_bank_account] in the error response.

item.name: Get a single Creditor Bank Account

request.description:
Retrieves the details of an existing creditor bank account.

[Get a single Creditor Bank Account API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#creditor-bank-accounts-get-a-single-creditor-bank-account)

response.name: Get a single Creditor Bank Account

request.description:
Immediately disables the bank account, no money can be paid out to a disabled account.

This will return a disable_failed error if the bank account has already been disabled.

A disabled bank account can be re-enabled by creating a new bank account resource with the same details.

[Disable a Creditor Bank Account API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#creditor-bank-accounts-disable-a-creditor-bank-account)

response.name: Disable a Creditor Bank Account

item.description:
Creditor Bank Accounts hold the bank details of a creditor. These are the bank accounts which your payouts will be sent to.

Note that creditor bank accounts must be unique, and so you will encounter a bank_account_exists error if you try to create a duplicate bank account. You may wish to handle this by updating the existing record instead, the ID of which will be provided as links[creditor_bank_account] in the error response.

Restricted: This API is not available for partner integrations.

item.name: Customer Notifications

request.description:
‚ÄúHandling‚Äù a notification means that you have sent the notification yourself (and don‚Äôt want GoCardless to send it). If the notification has already been actioned, or the deadline to notify has passed, this endpoint will return an already_actioned error and you should not take further action. This endpoint takes no additional parameters.

[Handle a notification API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#customer-notifications-handle-a-notification)

response.name: Handle a notification

item.description:
Customer Notifications represent the notification which is due to be sent to a customer after an event has happened. The event, the resource and the customer to be notified are all identified in the links property.

Note that these are ephemeral records - once the notification has been actioned in some way, it is no longer visible using this API.

Restricted: This API is currently only available for approved integrators - please get in touch if you would like to use this API.

item.description: Events are stored for all webhooks. An event refers to a resource which has been updated, for example a payment which has been collected, or a mandate which has been transferred. See here for a complete list of event types.

item.name: Instalment Schedules

request.description:
Creates a new instalment schedule object, along with the associated payments. This API is recommended if you know the specific dates you wish to charge. Otherwise, please check out the scheduling version.

The instalments property is an array of payment properties (amount and charge_date).

It can take quite a while to create the associated payments, so the API will return the status as pending initially. When processing has completed, a subsequent GET request for the instalment schedule will either have the status success and link to the created payments, or the status error and detailed information about the failures.

[Create with dates API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#instalment-schedules-create-with-dates)

response.name: Create Instalment Schedules  (with dates)

request.description:
Creates a new instalment schedule object, along with the associated payments. This API is recommended if you wish to use the GoCardless scheduling logic. For finer control over the individual dates, please check out the alternative version.

It can take quite a while to create the associated payments, so the API will return the status as pending initially. When processing has completed, a subsequent GET request for the instalment schedule will either have the status success and link to the created payments, or the status error and detailed information about the failures.

[Create with schedules API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#instalment-schedules-create-with-schedule)

response.name: Create Instalment Schedules (with schedule)

request.description:
Retrieves the details of an existing instalment schedule.

[Get instalment schedule API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#instalment-schedules-get-a-single-instalment-schedule)

response.name: Get a Single Instalment Schedules

request.description:
Updates an instalment schedule. This accepts only the metadata parameter.

[Update an instalment schedule API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#instalment-schedules-update-an-instalment-schedule)

response.name: Update an Instalment Schedule

request.description:
Immediately cancels an instalment schedule; no further payments will be collected for it.

This will fail with a cancellation_failed error if the instalment schedule is already cancelled or has completed.


[Cancel an instalment schedule API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#instalment-schedules-cancel-an-instalment-schedule)

response.name: Cancel an Instalment Schedule

item.description:
Instalment schedules are objects which represent a collection of related payments, with the intention to collect the total_amount specified. The API supports both schedule-based creation (similar to subscriptions) as well as explicit selection of differing payment amounts and charge dates.

Unlike subscriptions, the payments are created immediately, so the instalment schedule cannot be modified once submitted and instead can only be cancelled (which will cancel any of the payments which have not yet been submitted).

Customers will receive a single notification about the complete schedule of collection.

item.name: Mandates

request.description:
***Please consider using the [Billing Requests API](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests) instead of Mandates for any future integrations.***

Creates a new mandate object.

Restricted: this endpoint is restricted to GoCardless Pro and GoCardless Enterprise accounts with approved payment pages. 

[Create a mandate API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#mandates-create-a-mandate)

response.name: Create a Mandate

request.description:
Updates a mandate object. This accepts only the metadata parameter.

[Update a mandate API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#mandates-update-a-mandate)

response.name: Update a Mandate

request.description:
Retrieves the details of an existing mandate.

[Get a single mandate API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#mandates-get-a-single-mandate)

response.name: Get a single Mandate

request.description:
Immediately cancels a mandate and all associated cancellable payments. Any metadata supplied to this endpoint will be stored on the mandate cancellation event it causes.

This will fail with a cancellation_failed error if the mandate is already cancelled.

[Cancel a mandate API docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#mandates-cancel-a-mandate)

response.name: Cancel a Mandate

request.description:
Reinstates a cancelled or expired mandate to the banks. You will receive a resubmission_requested webhook, but after that reinstating the mandate follows the same process as its initial creation, so you will receive a submitted webhook, followed by a reinstated or failed webhook up to two working days later. Any metadata supplied to this endpoint will be stored on the resubmission_requested event it causes.

This will fail with a mandate_not_inactive error if the mandate is already being submitted, or is active.

Mandates can be resubmitted up to 10 times.

[Reinstate a mandate API docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#mandates-reinstate-a-mandate)

response.name: Reinstate a Mandate

item.description: Mandates represent the Direct Debit mandate with a customer.

item.name: Mandate Imports

request.description:
Mandate imports are first created, before mandates are added one-at-a-time, so this endpoint merely signals the start of the import process. Once you‚Äôve finished adding entries to an import, you should submit it.

[Create a mandate import API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#mandate-imports-create-a-new-mandate-import)

response.name: Create New Mandate Import

request.description:
Submits the mandate import, which allows it to be processed by a member of the GoCardless team. Once the import has been submitted, it can no longer have entries added to it.

In our sandbox environment, to aid development, we automatically process mandate imports approximately 10 seconds after they are submitted. This will allow you to test both the ‚Äúsubmitted‚Äù response and wait for the webhook to confirm the processing has begun.

[Create a mandate import API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#mandate-imports-submit-a-mandate-import)

response.name: Submit Mandate Import

request.description:
Cancels the mandate import, which aborts the import process and stops the mandates being set up in GoCardless. Once the import has been cancelled, it can no longer have entries added to it. Mandate imports which have already been submitted or processed cannot be cancelled.


[Cancel a mandate import API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#mandate-imports-cancel-a-mandate-import)

response.name: Cancel Mandate Import

request.description:
Returns a single mandate import.

[Get a mandate import API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#mandate-imports-get-a-mandate-import)

response.name: Get a Single Mandate import

item.description:
Mandate Imports allow you to migrate existing mandates from other providers into the GoCardless platform.

[Mandate Imports Developers Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#core-endpoints-mandate-imports)

item.name: Mandate Import Entries

request.description:
For an existing mandate import, this endpoint can be used to add individual mandates to be imported into GoCardless.

You can add no more than 30,000 rows to a single mandate import. If you attempt to go over this limit, the API will return a record_limit_exceeded error.

[Add a Mandate Import Entries API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#mandate-import-entries-add-a-mandate-import-entry)

response.name: Add Mandate import Entry

query.description: required. Unique identifier, beginning with ‚ÄúIM‚Äù.
Cursor pointing to the start of the desired set.
Cursor pointing to the end of the desired set.
Number of records to return.

request.description:
For an existing mandate import, this endpoint lists all of the entries attached.

After a mandate import has been submitted, you can use this endpoint to associate records in your system (using the record_identifier that you provided when creating the mandate import).

[List all Mandate Import Entries API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#mandate-import-entries-list-all-mandate-import-entries)

response.name: List All Mandate Import Entries

query.description: required. Unique identifier, beginning with ‚ÄúIM‚Äù.
Cursor pointing to the start of the desired set.
Cursor pointing to the end of the desired set.
Number of records to return.

item.description:
Mandate Import Entries are added to a Mandate Import. Each entry corresponds to one mandate to be imported into GoCardless.

[Mandate Import Entries Developers Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#core-endpoints-mandate-import-entries)

item.name: Payer Authorisations (deprecated)

request.description:
***Payer Authorisations is deprecated in favour of Billing Requests. Please consider using Billing Requests to build any future integrations.***

Creates a Payer Authorisation. The resource is saved to the database even if incomplete. An empty array of incomplete_fields means that the resource is valid. The ID of the resource is used for the other actions. This endpoint has been designed this way so you do not need to save any payer data on your servers or the browser while still being able to implement a progressive solution, such as a multi-step form.

*Note: the region field should be uncommented for US customer addresses.*

*Note: Customer bank accounts can be created with local or international bank details. You can find the different local bank detail formats, and how they should be used with the GoCardless API [here.](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#appendix-local-bank-details)*

[Create a Payer Authorisations API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#payer-authorisations-create-a-payer-authorisation)

response.name: Create a Payer Authorisation

request.description:
***Payer Authorisations is deprecated in favour of Billing Requests. Please consider using Billing Requests to build any future integrations.***

Updates a Payer Authorisation. Updates the Payer Authorisation with the request data. Can be invoked as many times as needed. Only fields present in the request will be modified. An empty array of incomplete_fields means that the resource is valid. This endpoint has been designed this way so you do not need to save any payer data on your servers or the browser while still being able to implement a progressive solution, such a multi-step form.

*Note: the region field should be uncommented for US customer addresses.*

*Note: Customer bank accounts can be created with local or international bank details. You can find the different local bank detail formats, and how they should be used with the GoCardless API [here.](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#appendix-local-bank-details)*

[Update a Payer Authorisations API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#payer-authorisations-update-a-payer-authorisation)

response.name: Update a Payer Authorisation

request.description:
***Payer Authorisations is deprecated in favour of Billing Requests. Please consider using Billing Requests to build any future integrations.***

Submits all the data previously pushed to this PayerAuthorisation for verification. This time, a 200 HTTP status is returned if the resource is valid and a 422 error response in case of validation errors. After it is successfully submitted, the Payer Authorisation can no longer be edited.

[Submit a Payer Authorisations API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#payer-authorisations-submit-a-payer-authorisation)

response.name: Submit a Payer Authorisation

request.description:
***Payer Authorisations is deprecated in favour of Billing Requests. Please consider using Billing Requests to build any future integrations.***

Confirms the Payer Authorisation, indicating that the resources are ready to be created. A Payer Authorisation cannot be confirmed if it hasn‚Äôt been submitted yet.

[Confirm a Payer Authorisations API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#payer-authorisations-confirm-a-payer-authorisation)

response.name: Confirm a Payer Authorisation

request.description:
***Payer Authorisations is deprecated in favour of Billing Requests. Please consider using Billing Requests to build any future integrations.***

Retrieves the details of a single existing Payer Authorisation. It can be used for polling the status of a Payer Authorisation.

[Get a Payer Authorisations API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#payer-authorisations-get-a-single-payer-authorisation)

response.name: Get a Payer Authorisation

item.description:
***Payer Authorisations is deprecated in favour of Billing Requests. Please consider using Billing Requests to build any future integrations.***

Payer Authorisation resource acts as a wrapper for creating customer, bank account and mandate details in a single request. PayerAuthorisation API enables the integrators to build their own custom payment pages.

[Payer Authorisations API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#core-endpoints-payer-authorisations)

item.name: Payments

request.description:
Creates a new payment object.

This fails with a mandate_is_inactive error if the linked mandate is cancelled or has failed. Payments can be created against mandates with status of: pending_customer_approval, pending_submission, submitted, and active.

[Create a Payment API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#payments-create-a-payment)

response.name: Create a Payment

request.description:
Updates a payment object. This accepts only the metadata parameter.

[Update a Payment API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#payments-update-a-payment)

response.name: Update a Payment

query.description: Cursor pointing to the start of the desired set.
Cursor pointing to the end of the desired set.
Limit to records where the payment was or will be collected from the customer‚Äôs bank account after the specified date.
Limit to records where the payment was or will be collected from the customer‚Äôs bank account on or after the specified date.
Limit to records where the payment was or will be collected from the customer‚Äôs bank account before the specified date.
Limit to records where the payment was or will be collected from the customer‚Äôs bank account on or before the specified date.
Limit to records created after the specified date-time.
Limit to records created on or after the specified date-time.
Limit to records created before the specified date-time.
Limit to records created on or before the specified date-time.
ID of a creditor to filter payments by. If you pass this parameter, you cannot also pass customer.
ISO 4217 currency code. Currently ‚ÄúAUD‚Äù, ‚ÄúCAD‚Äù, ‚ÄúDKK‚Äù, ‚ÄúEUR‚Äù, ‚ÄúGBP‚Äù, ‚ÄúNZD‚Äù, ‚ÄúSEK‚Äù and ‚ÄúUSD‚Äù are supported.
ID of a customer to filter payments by. If you pass this parameter, you cannot also pass creditor.
Number of records to return.
Unique identifier, beginning with ‚ÄúMD‚Äù. Note that this prefix may not apply to mandates created before 2016.

The direction to sort in. One of:
- asc
- desc

Field by which to sort records. One of:
- charge_date
- amount

One of: 
- pending_customer_approval
- pending_submission
- submitted
- confirmed
- paid_out
- cancelled
- customer_approval_denied
- failed
- charged_back
Unique identifier, beginning with ‚ÄúSB‚Äù.

request.description:
Retrieves the details of a single existing payment.

[Get a single Payment API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#payments-get-a-single-payment)

response.name: Get a single Payment

request.description:
Retries a failed payment if the underlying mandate is active. You will receive a resubmission_requested webhook, but after that retrying the payment follows the same process as its initial creation, so you will receive a submitted webhook, followed by a confirmed or failed event. Any metadata supplied to this endpoint will be stored against the payment submission event it causes.

This will return a retry_failed error if the payment has not failed.

Payments can be retried up to 3 times.

[Retry a failed payment API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#payments-retry-a-payment)

response.name: Retry Payment

request.description:
Cancels the payment if it has not already been submitted to the banks. Any metadata supplied to this endpoint will be stored on the payment cancellation event it causes.

This will fail with a cancellation_failed error unless the payment‚Äôs status is pending_submission.

[Cancel a payment API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#payments-cancel-a-payment)

response.name: Cancel a Payment

item.description:
Payment objects represent payments from a customer to a creditor, taken against a Direct Debit mandate.

GoCardless will notify you via a webhook whenever the state of a payment changes.

item.name: Payouts

query.description: Cursor pointing to the start of the desired set.
Cursor pointing to the end of the desired set.
Limit to records created after the specified date-time.
Limit to records created on or after the specified date-time.
Limit to records created before the specified date-time.
Limit to records created on or before the specified date-time.
Unique identifier, beginning with ‚ÄúCR‚Äù.
Unique identifier, beginning with ‚ÄúBA‚Äù.
ISO 4217 currency code. Currently ‚ÄúAUD‚Äù, ‚ÄúCAD‚Äù, ‚ÄúDKK‚Äù, ‚ÄúEUR‚Äù, ‚ÄúGBP‚Äù, ‚ÄúNZD‚Äù, ‚ÄúSEK‚Äù and ‚ÄúUSD‚Äù are supported.
Number of records to return.
Key-value store of custom data. Up to 3 keys are permitted, with key names up to 50 characters and values up to 500 characters. Note: This should not be used for storing PII data.
Whether a payout contains merchant revenue or partner fees.
Reference which appears on the creditor‚Äôs bank statement.

One of:
- pending: the payout has been created, but not yet sent to your bank or it is in the process of being exchanged through our FX provider.

- paid: the payout has been sent to the your bank. FX payouts will become paid after we emit the fx_rate_confirmed webhook.

- bounced: the payout bounced when sent, the payout can be retried.

request.description:
Returns a cursor-paginated list of your payouts.

[List Payouts API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#payouts-list-payouts)

response.name: List Payouts

request.description:
Retrieves the details of a single payout. For an example of how to reconcile the transactions in a payout, see this guide.

[Get a single payout API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#payouts-get-a-single-payout)

response.name: Get a single Payout

request.description:
Updates a payout object. This accepts only the metadata parameter.

[Update a Payout API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#payouts-update-a-payout)

response.name: Update a Payout

item.description: Payouts represent transfers from GoCardless to a creditor. Each payout contains the funds collected from one or many payments. All the payments in a payout will have been collected in the same currency. Payouts are created automatically after a payment has been successfully collected.

item.name: Payout Items

query.description: required Unique identifier, beginning with ‚ÄúPO‚Äù.
Cursor pointing to the start of the desired set.
Cursor pointing to the end of the desired set.
Boolean value indicating whether the API should return tax data for the cutover period of April to August 2020. Defaults to false.
Number of records to return.

request.description:
Returns a cursor-paginated list of items in the payout.

[Get payout items API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#payout-items-get-all-payout-items-in-a-single-payout)

response.name: List All Payout Items

query.description: required Unique identifier, beginning with ‚ÄúPO‚Äù.
Cursor pointing to the start of the desired set.
Cursor pointing to the end of the desired set.
Boolean value indicating whether the API should return tax data for the cutover period of April to August 2020. Defaults to false.
Number of records to return.

item.description:
When we collect a payment on your behalf, we add the money you‚Äôve collected to your GoCardless balance, minus any fees paid. Periodically (usually every working day), we take any positive balance in your GoCardless account, and pay it out to your nominated bank account.

Other actions in your GoCardless account can also affect your balance. For example, if a customer charges back a payment, we‚Äôll deduct the payment‚Äôs amount from your balance, but add any fees you paid for that payment back to your balance.

The Payout Items API allows you to view, on a per-payout basis, the credit and debit items that make up that payout‚Äôs amount.

item.name: Redirect Flows

request.description:
***Please consider using the [Billing Requests API](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests) instead of Redirect Flows for any future integrations.***

Creates a redirect flow object which can then be used to redirect your customer to the GoCardless hosted payment pages.

[Create a Redirect Flow API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#redirect-flows-create-a-redirect-flow)

response.name: Create a Redirect Flow

request.description:
***Please consider using the [Billing Requests API](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests) instead of Redirect Flows for any future integrations.***

This creates a customer, customer bank account, and mandate using the details supplied by your customer and returns the ID of the created mandate.

This will return a redirect_flow_incomplete error if your customer has not yet been redirected back to your site, and a redirect_flow_already_completed error if your integration has already completed this flow. It will return a bad_request error if the session_token differs to the one supplied when the redirect flow was created.

[Complete a Redirect Flow API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#redirect-flows-complete-a-redirect-flow)

response.name: Complete a single Redirect Flow

request.description:
***Please consider using the [Billing Requests API](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests) instead of Redirect Flows for any future integrations.***

Returns all details about a single redirect flow

[Get a Redirect Flow API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#redirect-flows-get-a-single-redirect-flow)

response.name: Get a single Redirect Flow

item.description:
***Please consider using the [Billing Requests API](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#billing-requests) instead of Redirect Flows for any future integrations.***

Redirect flows enable you to use GoCardless‚Äô hosted payment pages to set up mandates with your customers. These pages are fully compliant and have been translated into Danish, Dutch, French, German, Italian, Norwegian, Portuguese, Slovak, Spanish and Swedish.

The overall flow is:

1. You create a redirect flow for your customer, and redirect them to the returned redirect url, e.g. https://pay.gocardless.com/flow/RE123.
2. Your customer supplies their name, email, address, and bank account details, and submits the form. This securely stores their details, and redirects them back to your success_redirect_url with redirect_flow_id=RE123 in the querystring.
3. You complete the redirect flow, which creates a customer, customer bank account, and mandate, and returns the ID of the mandate. You may wish to create a subscription or payment at this point.

Once you have completed the redirect flow via the API, you should display a confirmation page to your customer, confirming that their Direct Debit has been set up. You can build your own page, or redirect to the one we provide in the confirmation_url attribute of the redirect flow.

Redirect flows expire 30 minutes after they are first created. You cannot complete an expired redirect flow.

[Redirect Flows API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#core-endpoints-redirect-flows)

item.description:
Refund objects represent (partial) refunds of a payment back to the customer.

GoCardless will notify you via a webhook whenever a refund is created, and will update the amount_refunded property of the payment.

item.description:
Scenario Simulators allow you to manually trigger and test certain paths that your integration will encounter in the real world. These endpoints are only active in the sandbox environment.

[https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#core-endpoints-scenario-simulators](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#core-endpoints-scenario-simulators)

item.name: Scheme Identifiers

request.description:
Creates a new scheme identifier. The scheme identifier must be¬†[applied to a creditor](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#creditors-apply-a-scheme-identifier)¬†before payments are taken using it. The scheme identifier must also have the¬†`status`¬†of active before it can be used. For some schemes e.g. faster_payments this will happen instantly. For other schemes e.g. bacs this can take several days.

Relative endpoint:¬†`POST /scheme_identifiers`

[Create a Scheme Identifier API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#scheme-identifiers-create-a-scheme-identifier)

Retrieves the details of a single subscription.

response.name: Get a single Subscription

request.description:
Pause a subscription object. No payments will be created until it is resumed.

This can only be used when a subscription is collecting a fixed number of payments (created using count), when they continue forever (created without count or end_date) or the subscription is already paused for a number of cycles.

[Pause a Subscription API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#subscriptions-pause-a-subscription)

request.description:
Immediately cancels a subscription; no more payments will be created under it. Any metadata supplied to this endpoint will be stored on the payment cancellation event it causes.

This will fail with a cancellation_failed error if the subscription is already cancelled or finished.

[Cancel a Subscription API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#subscriptions-cancel-a-subscription)

request.description:
Resume a subscription object. Payments will start to be created again based on the subscriptions recurrence rules. The charge_date on the next payment will be the same as the subscriptions earliest_charge_date_after_resume

[Resume a Subscription API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#subscriptions-resume-a-subscription)

item.description: [https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#core-endpoints-webhooks](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#core-endpoints-webhooks)

Core API calls for the GoCardless API that allow you to set and retrieve various GoCardless resources.

For Customer and Payment creation, please first look at BIlling Requests.

item.name: Helper Endpoints

request.description:
Mandate PDFs allow you to easily display scheme-rules compliant Direct Debit mandates to your customers.

Generates a PDF mandate and returns its temporary URL.

[Create a mandate PDF API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#helper-endpoints-mandate-pdfs)

request.description:
Look up the name and reachability of a bank account.

*Note: bank accounts can be created with local or international bank details. You can find the different local bank detail formats, and how they should be used with the GoCardless API [here.](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#appendix-local-bank-details)*

[Bank Details Lookup API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#bank-details-lookups-perform-a-bank-details-lookup)

response.name: Bank Details Lookup

request.description:
We expose a health check endpoint which can be used to test connections to our API. Requests to this endpoint do not require authorization and are not rate limited. This endpoint will return a `200` response while our API is available.

- `https://api.gocardless.com/health_check` for live
    
- `https://api-sandbox.gocardless.com/health_check` for sandbox
    

[Health check API Docs](https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference/#helper-endpoints-healthcheck)

response.name: Healthcheck
response.body: {"active_record":"up","system":"up"}

item.description:
**Healthcheck**: We expose a health check endpoint which can be used to test connections to our API. Requests to this endpoint do not require authorization and are not rate limited. This endpoint will return a `200` response while our API is available.

**Mandate PDF:** Generates a PDF mandate and returns its temporary URL.

**Bank Details Lookup:** Look up the name and reachability of a bank account.
